verses.verse: It is all one thing; Therefore I say, ((Eccl. 9:2, 3); Ezek. 21:3) ‘He destroys the blameless and the wicked.’
If the scourge slays suddenly, He laughs at the plight of the innocent.
The earth is given into the hand of the wicked. He covers the faces of its judges. If it is not He, who else could it be?
“Now (Job 7:6, 7) my days are swifter than a runner; They flee away, they see no good.
They pass by like swift ships, (Job 39:29; Hab. 1:8) Like an eagle swooping on its prey.
(Job 7:13) If I say, ‘I will forget my complaint, I will put off my sad face and wear a smile,’
(Ps. 119:120) I am afraid of all my sufferings; I know that You (Ex. 20:7) will not hold me innocent.
If I am condemned, Why then do I labor in vain?
((Jer. 2:22)) If I wash myself with snow water, And cleanse my hands with soap,
Yet You will plunge me into the pit, And my own clothes will abhor me.
“For (Eccl. 6:10; (Is. 45:9; Jer. 49:19; Rom. 9:20)) He is not a man, as I am, That I may answer Him, And that we should go to court together.
((1 Sam. 2:25); Job 9:19; Is. 1:18) Nor is there any mediator between us, Who may lay his hand on us both.
(Job 13:20, 21; Ps. 39:10) Let Him take His rod away from me, And do not let dread of Him terrify me.
Then I would speak and not fear Him, But it is not so with me.
(Job: I Would Plead with God) “My (1 Kin. 19:4; Job 7:16; Jon. 4:3) soul loathes my life; I will give free course to my complaint, (Job 7:11) I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
I will say to God, ‘Do not condemn me; Show me why You contend with me.
Does it seem good to You that You should oppress, That You should despise the work of Your hands, And smile on the counsel of the wicked?
Do You have eyes of flesh? Or ((1 Sam. 16:7; Job 28:24; 34:21)) do You see as man sees?
Are Your days like the days of a mortal man? Are Your years like the days of a mighty man,
That You should seek for my iniquity And search out my sin,
Although You know that I am not wicked, And there is no one who can deliver from Your hand?
‘Your (Job 10:3; Ps. 119:73) hands have made me and fashioned me, An intricate unity; Yet You would ((Job 9:22)) destroy me.
